title: MD
biography:
Ramakanta Panda, is an Indian cardiac surgeon and the chief consultant for cardiovascular thoracic surgery and the Chairman of the Asian Heart Institute, a speciality cardiac care hospital under the aegis of Asian Hospitals, at the Bandra-Kurla Complex in Mumbai, India. In 2002, he set up the Asian Heart Institute in India. Panda has performed about 30,000 successful cardiac surgeries, including more than 2,000 redo surgeries and 6,000+ high-risk surgeries
He was awarded the Padma Bhushan in 2010 by the Government of India. With a 99.8% success rate in bypass surgery, he is widely considered the worldâ€™s safest cardiac surgeon. Currently, he is the Chairman of Asian Heart Institute in Mumbai.
aiSummary: Ramakanta Panda is a cardiac surgery specialist with an H-index of 110 at Asian Heart Institute (Faculty). Has been published in Brain sciences, Frontiers in plant science, Frontiers in human neuroscience. Based in India.
